alert.note: Alert for North Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 7:01PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Platte County through 745 PM MDT... At 700 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Westview Circle, or 8 miles west of Wheatland, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wheatland, Chugcreek, Lakeview North, Bordeaux, Westview Circle, Y-O Ranch and Slater. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 70 and 88. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
